headline: This week’s cover

children.data: cover looks at why the world’s battle with inflation is far from over. Today’s investors are betting that inflation, the world economy’s biggest problem, can be brought down without much fuss. But there may be turbulence ahead.
Inflation will be harder to bring down than markets think
Lots of investors think inflation is under control. Not so fast
For subscribers only: to see how we design each week’s cover, sign up to our weekly

bodyText:
Our global cover looks at why the world’s battle with inflation is far from over. Today’s investors are betting that inflation, the world economy’s biggest problem, can be brought down without much fuss. But there may be turbulence ahead. 

Leaders: Inflation will be harder to bring down than markets think
Briefing: Lots of investors think inflation is under control. Not so fast
For subscribers only: to see how we design each week’s cover, sign up to our weekly Cover Story newsletter.

parts.headline: Inflation will be harder to bring down than markets think
parts.description: Investors are betting on good times. The likelier prospect is turbulence

parts.headline: Nicola Sturgeon’s resignation is part of Britain’s great moderation
parts.description: Pragmatism is taking hold north and south of the border

parts.headline: Israel’s proposed legal reforms are a dreadful answer to a real problem
parts.description: They will damage the country at home and abroad

parts.headline: The world won’t decarbonise fast enough unless renewables make real money
parts.description: Governments must accept that green power is pricey

parts.headline: Nigeria desperately needs a new kind of leadership
parts.description: Peter Obi offers the best hope of it

parts.headline: Letters to the editor
parts.subheadline: On China and space, Turkey, Paul Pennyfeather, Pakistan, The Gambia, banking, old age
parts.description: A selection of correspondence

_metadata.articleBody:
Our global cover looks at why the world’s battle with inflation is far from over. Today’s investors are betting that inflation, the world economy’s biggest problem, can be brought down without much fuss. But there may be turbulence ahead. 

Leaders: Inflation will be harder to bring down than markets think
